channel.title: Battlescape client [if fixed will pay]
channel.description:
Alright so i've downloaded a battlescape source (directly from palidino76) and i'm trying to use the client. However, whenever i try to log in my server this happens;
[code] Exception in thread "Thread-4" java.lang.NullPointerException at client.openSocket(client.java:459) at client.login(client.java:6396) at client.processLoginScreenInput(client.java:11038) at client.processGameLoop(client.java:2273) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:138) at client.run(client.java:4865) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
[/code]
It'd be nice if you could tell me or explain how i could attempt to fix this. Also, whenever i try to log in localhost, it works, but whenever i put my servers IP, the client crashes on log in.

item.title: Battlescape client [if fixed will pay]
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

I’ll have to admit I don’t quite know. If you say you can log in from localHost but not an IP address then just check you got the DUC on and checked, and it declared correctly.

Maybe someone else will come along and suggest something.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlescape client [if fixed will pay]
item.dc:creator: @adog17x adog17x
item.description:
@adog17x wrote:

I’ve got the z-filesearcher and i’ve searched ‘server’ ‘serverip’, ect ect and nothing. Many people have changed the ‘new url’ thing and got it to work. I’ve read into it and people were talking about how the interfaces mess things up, but other than that I wouldn’t know whats wrong. I can connect using 127.0.0.1 with no client errors but as soon as i add my IP the client crashes whenever i try to log in

GUI.java only contains the buttons used to get to the forums/ect, which I don’t have/need.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlescape client [if fixed will pay]
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Hmm, maybe I’m forgetting that the IP is in GUI.java or EGUI.java, I can’t remember about BattleScape anymore, been a while. There could possibly be another file containing the IP.

Check the others, better still, get a Z-FileSearcher and search every file at the same time for any signs of an IP address so you can locate it. I don’t think “new URL” is the place for the connecting IP. That’s web client I believe…

Read full topic

item.title: Battlescape client [if fixed will pay]
item.dc:creator: @adog17x adog17x
item.description:
@adog17x wrote:

http://up.ht/nSjLIR

It wouldn’t let me attach it but I’m sure you can tell it’s a .txt file. Thank you. I’ve tried. Even googled solutions and nothing has worked.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlescape client [if fixed will pay]
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

I’m not sure that’s it… Search for “Server =” or something like that. Can you attach your Client.java?

item.title: Battlescape client [if fixed will pay]
item.dc:creator: @adog17x adog17x
item.description:
@adog17x wrote:

public URL getCodeBase() { if(signlink.mainapp != null) return signlink.mainapp.getCodeBase(); try { return new URL("based.no-ip.org:43676"); } catch(Exception _ex) { } return null; }

only place so far that I personally know :\

Read full topic

item.title: Battlescape client [if fixed will pay]
item.dc:creator: @adog17x adog17x
item.description:
@adog17x wrote:

Alright so i’ve downloaded a battlescape source (directly from palidino76) and i’m trying to use the client. However, whenever i try to log in my server this happens;

Exception in thread "Thread-4" java.lang.NullPointerException
        at client.openSocket(client.java:459)
        at client.login(client.java:6396)
        at client.processLoginScreenInput(client.java:11038)
        at client.processGameLoop(client.java:2273)
        at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:138)
        at client.run(client.java:4865)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

It’d be nice if you could tell me or explain how i could attempt to fix this.
Also, whenever i try to log in localhost, it works, but whenever i put my servers IP, the client crashes on log in.

Read full topic
